meanings.definition: To bring to a state of perfection
meanings.sent1: She worked hard to consummate her painting, adding final touches to make it perfect.
meanings.sent2: The chef will consummate the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs before serving.
meanings.sent3: Trying to consummate a messy room before guests arrive is always a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The team's effort to consummate the project was like putting the last piece in a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to consummate his skills as a musician paid off during the concert.

meanings.sent1: The missing ingredient will consummate the recipe and make it delicious.
meanings.sent2: The final chapter will consummate the story and tie up all loose ends.
meanings.sent3: Her decision to consummate the jigsaw puzzle in one sitting was ambitious.
meanings.sent4: The handshake will consummate the business deal between the two companies.
meanings.sent5: The last brushstroke will consummate the painting and bring it to life.

meanings.definition: Perfect or ideal in every way
meanings.sent1: The couple had a consummate wedding ceremony that was flawless.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece was a consummate example of talent and skill.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to nap all day is a consummate skill that many envy.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a consummate display of colors.
meanings.sent5: The team's performance was consummate, leaving the audience in awe.
